articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
This week we’ve added to the Leafly database a collection of sativas, indicas, and hybrids with rich genetic backgrounds that will make you appreciate the care that goes into the breeding process. From TGA Seeds, we have Dr. Who and The Third Dimension, two hybrids that will help you in your magical journeys through time and space. Nevil’s Wreck is everything you’d want in a sativa strain, especially if you’re a patient treating depression or fatigue. Kandahar blesses us with age-old indica genetics that stretch back to Afghanistan, and the newer Kushadelic proves that not all indicas will knock you out cold.
Did you come across any new strains this week? Share your thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a review for your fellow Leafly comrades!
1. Dr. Who
Characteristics of Dr. Who:

60% indica-dominant hybrid
Cross between Mad Scientist and Timewreck
Breeder: TGA Genetics
Pineapple and grape aroma
Clear-headed and relaxing
May help with pain, stress, appetite loss, multiple sclerosis, ADHD, mood disorders, and nausea
Indoor flowering time of 56 to 63 days

2. Nevil’s Wreck
Characteristics of Nevil’s Wreck:

80% sativa
Cross between Arcata Trainwreck and Neville’s Haze
Breeder: Rare Dankness Seeds
Spicy, floral aroma
Uplifting and alert
May treat depression, fatigue, and appetite loss
Indoor flowering time of 65 to 115 days

3. Kandahar
Characteristics of Kandahar:

90% indica
Cross between Afghani and an unknown Afghani Skunk
Breeder: Ministry of Cannabis
Earthy, woody, nutty aroma
Powerful but functional buzz, relaxing
Indoor flowering time of 8 to 9 weeks

4. Kushadelic
Characteristics of Kushadelic:

80% indica
Cross between G-13 Haze and OG Kush
Earthy, floral, citrus aroma
Comfortable, versatile effects conducive for social gatherings
Indoor flowering time of 10 to 11 weeks

5. The Third Dimension
Characteristics of The Third Dimension:

60% sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Apollo 13, Jack’s Cleaner, and Space Queen
Breeder: TGA Genetics
Mango, pineapple, and lemon aroma
Creative and stress-relieving
Indoor flowering time of 45 to 50 days
articles.title: New Strains Alert: Dr. Who, Nevil’s Wreck, Kandahar, Kushadelic, and The Third Dimension

description: Kandahar, named after the homeland of its ancestor, is a 90% indica strain bred by the Ministry of Cannabis. Its Afghani parent, grown near the city of Kandahar, was crossed with an unknown Afghan Skunk hybrid to help lighten some of the indica intensity. The result is a powerful but functional strain that goes best with relaxing activities at home. Its aroma is a complex blend of earthy wood with nutty undertones that are only fully realized in Kandahar’s taste. Kandahar exhibits the typical indica stature: short, bushy plants with thick layers of crystal trichomes. Indoor gardens finish flowering between 8 and 9 weeks, while outdoor harvest falls at the beginning of October.
descriptionPlain: Kandahar, named after the homeland of its ancestor, is a 90% indica strain bred by the Ministry of Cannabis. Its Afghani parent, grown near the city of Kandahar, was crossed with an unknown Afghan Skunk hybrid to help lighten some of the indica intensity. The result is a powerful but functional strain that goes best with relaxing activities at home. Its aroma is a complex blend of earthy wood with nutty undertones that are only fully realized in Kandahar’s taste. Kandahar exhibits the typical indica stature: short, bushy plants with thick layers of crystal trichomes. Indoor gardens finish flowering between 8 and 9 weeks, while outdoor harvest falls at the beginning of October.

highlightedReviews.text:
BEST EVER!!!!
I am strictly an indica user for sleep and this one is THE a
Best.
2 hits and I'm ready for bed.  Never wake up.
It has a great flavor and no bad side effects.
No headache no dry mouth.
Awesome

Kandahar kush is a really nice evening or night  indica strain. Will definitely get you tired and ready to relax. You’ll feel the high in your eyes, forehead, and most of your head. This gives a classic “Stoney” high and gives your body a nice body buzz. The buds themselves are good in size and somewhat frosty and covered in orange hairs. The smell is earthy, citrusy, and slightly sweet. This is a very nice strain for relaxing but nothing amazing. I’ll still give it a 4.5 Stars

name: Kandahar
